Class NeonClient

java.lang.Object
com.quietterminal.projectneon.client.NeonClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Lifecycle, AutoCloseable
public class NeonClient extends Object implements AutoCloseable, Lifecycle
Neon protocol client implementation. Implements Lifecycle for clean start/stop semantics.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public boolean connect(int sessionId, String relayAddress) throws IOException
      Connects to a relay server and joins a session.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • processPackets

      public int processPackets() throws IOException
      Processes incoming packets. Should be called regularly in the game loop. Returns the number of packets processed.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • sendPing

      public void sendPing() throws IOException
      Sends a ping to the host.
      Throws:
      IOException

      public void start()
      Description copied from interface: Lifecycle
      Starts the component asynchronously. Transitions from CREATED to STARTING, then to RUNNING on success.
      Specified by:
      start in interface Lifecycle

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Description copied from interface: Lifecycle
      Stops the component gracefully. Transitions from RUNNING to STOPPING, then to STOPPED. Waits for pending operations to complete up to the configured timeout.
      Specified by:
      stop in interface Lifecycle

    • setTarget

      public NeonClient setTarget(int sessionId, String relayAddress)
      Sets the target session and relay for connection. Must be called before start() when using the Lifecycle interface.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - the session ID to connect to
      relayAddress - the relay address (host:port)
      Returns:
      this client for chaining

    • run

      public void run() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Runs the client in a blocking loop, processing packets.
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network error occurs
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • startAndRun

      public void startAndRun() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Starts the client, connects to relay, and runs the processing loop. Combines start() and run() for convenience.
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network error occurs
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • startAsync

      public Thread startAsync()
      Starts the client in a background thread using virtual threads if available (Java 21+). Falls back to platform threads on older JVMs. Requires setTarget() to be called first.
      Returns:
      the started thread

    • runAsync

      @Deprecated public Thread runAsync()
      Deprecated.
      Use startAsync() instead
      Runs the client processing loop in a background thread. Call connect() first to establish the connection.
      Returns:
      the started thread

      public Optional<Byte> getClientId()

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()

    • reconnect

      public boolean reconnect(int maxAttempts) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Attempts to reconnect to the session using the stored session token. Uses exponential backoff with configurable max attempts.
      Parameters:
      maxAttempts - Maximum number of reconnection attempts
      Returns:
      true if reconnection succeeded, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • reconnect

      public boolean reconnect() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Attempts to reconnect using default max attempts.
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException
